item.title: ester add a quote by Mary Pickford
item.description: "If you have made mistakes, even serious ones, there is always another chance for you. What we call failure is not the falling down but the staying down." -- Mary Pickford

item.title: ester add a quote by Charlotte Bronte
item.description: "Conventionality is not morality." -- Charlotte Bronte

item.title: ester add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "The future is no more uncertain than the present." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: ester add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "We are what we pretend to be, so we must be careful about what we pretend to be." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: ester add a quote by Iris Murdoch
item.description: "Writing is like getting married. One should never commit oneself until one is amazed at one's luck." -- Iris Murdoch

item.title: ester add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "War is what happens when language fails." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: ester add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "The true story is vicious and multiple and untrue after all. Why do you need it? Don’t ever ask for the true story." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: ester add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: ester add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: ester add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: ester add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "We don't see things as they are, we see them as we are." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: ester add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "The cure for boredom is curiosity. There is no cure for curiosity." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: ester add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "You gain strength, courage and confidence by every experience in which you really stop to look fear in the face. You are able to say to yourself, 'I have lived through this horror. I can take the next thing that comes along.' You must do the thing you think you cannot do." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: ester add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "There is a theory which states that if ever anyone discovers exactly what the Universe is for and why it is here, it will instantly disappear and be replaced by something even more bizarre and inexplicable. There is another theory which states that this has already happened." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: ester add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Fate is like a strange, unpopular restaurant filled with odd little waiters who bring you things you never asked for and don't always like." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: ester add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "Everyone thinks of changing the world, but no one thinks of changing himself." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: ester add a quote by Alan Moore
item.description: "My experience of life is that it is not divided up into genres; it’s a horrifying, romantic, tragic, comical, science-fiction cowboy detective novel. You know, with a bit of pornography if you're lucky." -- Alan Moore

item.title: ester add a quote by Russell Banks
item.description: "Lists of books we re-read and books we can't finish tell more about us than about the relative worth of the books themselves" -- Russell Banks

item.title: ester add a quote by Ann Patchett
item.description: "It makes you wonder. All the brilliant things we might have done with our lives if only we suspected we knew how." -- Ann Patchett

item.title: ester add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "If you don't have time to read, you don't have the time (or the tools) to write. Simple as that." -- Stephen King

item.title: ester add a quote by Jeanette Winterson
item.description: "I have noticed that doing the sensible thing is only a good idea when the decision is quite small. For the life-changing things, you must risk it." -- Jeanette Winterson

item.title: ester add a quote by Jeanette Winterson
item.description: "Our own front door can be a wonderful thing, or a sight we dread; rarely is it only a door." -- Jeanette Winterson

item.title: ester add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "For most of history, Anonymous was a woman." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: ester add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "There are books full of great writing that don't have very good stories. Read sometimes for the story... don't be like the book-snobs who won't do that. Read sometimes for the words--the language. Don't be like the play-it-safers who won't do that. But when you find a book that has both a good story and good words, treasure that book." -- Stephen King

item.title: ester add a quote by Joss Whedon
item.description: "Make it dark, make it grim, make it tough, but then, for the love of God, tell a joke." -- Joss Whedon

item.title: ester add a quote by Marian Keyes
item.description: "What doesn't kill us makes us funnier." -- Marian Keyes

item.title: ester add a quote by Rabih Alameddine
item.description: "...What happens is of little significance compared with the stories we tell ourselves about what happens. Events matter little, only stories of events affect us." -- Rabih Alameddine

item.title: ester add a quote by Rachel Kushner
item.description: "It was not the case that one thing morphed into another, child into woman. You remained the person you were before things happened to you. The person you were when you thought a small cut string could determine the course of a year. You also became the person to whom certain things happened. Who passed into the realm where you no longer questioned the notion of being trapped in one form. You took on that form, that identity, hoped for its recognition from others, hoped someone would love it and you." -- Rachel Kushner

item.title: ester add a quote by J. K. Rowling
item.description: "The thing about growing up with Fred and George," said Ginny thoughtfully, "is that you sort of start thinking anything's possible if you've got enough nerve." -- J. K. Rowling

item.title: ester add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "One can never have enough socks," said Dumbledore. "Another Christmas has come and gone and I didn't get a single pair. People will insist on giving me books." -- J.K. Rowling
